subject: Re: new font released
msgSnippet: Paul, I think the missing mappings are these: Ian - should be mapped to the W key (upper case w ). Earth - should be mapped to the x key (lower case x ).
messageBody:
Paul,

I think the missing mappings are these:

Ian - should be mapped to the "W" key (upper case "w").
Earth - should be mapped to the "x" key (lower case "x").

These are the key mappings for Jon Zuck's entire symbol list, except
for the last 4 "special" mappings, in the order he shows them in
"Revised Shaw Alphabet of Kingsley Read":

p t k f T s S c j h
b d g v H z Z J w `
N n a i e A y o Y U
m l r I E F Q q O M
W C X x R P V

If you just paste these into a word processor, select all of them, and
then convert to "Thoth" font, you should see which symbols are missing.

Jeff

--- In Read_Alphabet@yahoogroups.com, Paul Tremblay <phthenry@...> wrote:
>
> jeff_smith_8992 wrote:
> >
> >
> > Hi Paul,
> >
> > I just took a quick look at your Thoth font and have one quick
> > question. It looks like Thoth has all 40 of the numbered characters,
> > plus the "yoo" and "air" characters shown on the second page of the
> > pdf file for the "QuikScript Manual". But it only has 49 of the 51
> > symbols shown in Jon Zuck's "Revised Shaw Alphabet of Kingsley Read".
> > The characters for "Ian" and "Earth" are missing. I was wondering
> > why those two symbols were omitted. It seems like it would be nice to
> > have complete compatibility with the Jerome and Kingsley fonts.
> >
> > I haven't read all your messages regarding Thoth, so if you've already
> > addressed this, I apologize.
>
> Hi Jeff,
>
> Which ones are missing? I definitely put them in, but they might be in
> the wrong places. I really didn't have much to guide me except other
> fonts in regards to the situation. Just tell me what letter you are
> typing and then what QS character does not appear on your screen.
>
> Paul
>
